featured.text: “Suits are expensive, if you have to wear one every day,” one person said.
Linguistic research can be a very expensive business.
Is eating out too expensive for you?
They are heavily processed with more calories and sodium than meat and are more expensive too!
The energy and technology to desalinate water are both expensive, and this means that desalinating water can be costly.

other.text: After the 1960s, and especially since the 1980s, the high school prom in many areas has become a serious exercise in excessive consumption, with boys renting expensive tuxedos and girls wearing designer gowns.
As computers are getting less expensive, they are _______ used in schools and offices today.
It is absolutely _____ to waste your money on an expensive car when you cannot even get a driver’s license.
They were prized possessions made of expensive materials intended to impress guests.
Stretch limousines were hired to drive the prom-goers to expensive restaurants or discos for an all-night extravaganza.
But the new device was still relatively expensive and unreliable.
To stick to a tight budget, Robert bought a more ______ LED TV instead of a fancy, expensive 3D TV.
Based on the passage, in order to break into computer codes, one needs (A) an elaborate and expensive multi-media computer.
You don't even need a very expensive computer—but you must understand everything about all kinds of computers.

definition.en_def: Costing a lot of money; not cheap.
definition.example: The new smartphone is too expensive for my budget.
